intro: Lobelia trierarchii, commonly known as the Three-arched Lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Lobelia trierarchii is considered a rare and endangered species.
